meanings.definition: To spurt out suddenly in a stream.
meanings.sent1: The water splurted from the hose.
meanings.sent2: I saw the juice splurt out of the bottle.
meanings.sent3: The soda splurted all over when I opened it too fast.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter splurted out uncontrollably during the funny movie.
meanings.sent5: The volcano splurted lava into the air, creating a fiery display.

meanings.sent1: The sudden splurt of water surprised me.
meanings.sent2: I heard a splurt of laughter from the other room.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected splurt of confetti made the party even more fun.
meanings.sent4: The splurt of paint on the canvas added a unique touch to the artwork.
meanings.sent5: The splurt of oil from the machine caused a small mess in the workshop.
